definitions: To cause to become morally depraved; to debase.
To alter (something, such as a text or a computer file) from its original or correct state to one that is erroneous or invalid.
To influence (someone) to act dishonestly or illegally in return for money or personal gain.
examples: Power can corrupt even the best of intentions.
The virus managed to corrupt several important files.
They tried to corrupt the judge with a large bribe.
